name: Cleansing Shampoo
about: What it is:A deep-cleaning shampoo that clarifies, removes buildup, revives the scalp, and promotes strong hair without stripping away the healthy oils..Hair Type:Fine, Medium, and Thick.Hair Texture:Coily, Curly, and Wavy.Hair Concerns:- Oily Scalp.Key Benefits:- Removes buildup without stripping away healthy oils.Highlighted Ingredients:- Rosemary Leaf Extract.Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also cruelty-free and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:When it’s time for a deep clean, this Clarifying Shampoo removes buildup and revives the scalp to give tresses a fresh start without stripping away your hair's healthy oils. The formula features antioxidants, promotes strong hair, and helps improve moisture reception for low-porosity hair types. Pro tip: Use every 3rd wash or so to keep hair & scalp residue-free..Fragrance Description:Tracee picked this to smell clean and not overpowering, with notes of an exotic floral mélange of jasmine, bergamot, and sweet sandalwood.
ingredients: -Rosemary Leaf Extract .-Safflower Seed Extract .-Aloe Leaf Extract . .'Water/Aqua/Eau, Sodium C14-16 Olefin Sulfonate, Cocamidopropyl Betaine, Glycerin, Sodium Chloride, Polysorbate 20, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Caryodendron Orinocense Seed Oil, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Fruit Extract, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Extract, Cucumis Sativus (Cucumber) Fruit Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Panthenol, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Citric Acid, Cocamidopropyl Dimethylamine, PEG-60 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, PEG-120 Methyl Glucose Dioleate, Guar Hydroxypropyltrimonium Chloride, Disodium EDTA, Decyl Glucoside, Polyquaternium-10, C12-18 Acid Triglyceride, Sodium Glycolate, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Sulfite, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Benzoate, Phenethyl Alcohol, Fragrance/Parfum
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Massage vigorously into scalp and wet hair to remove buildup and residue..-Add more water as needed to work the product through the hair..-Rinse thoroughly. .-If desired, wash a second time with Pattern by Tracee Ellis Ross’s Hydration Shampoo (sold separately). .-Follow with your preferred Pattern by Tracee Ellis Ross conditioner. .-Avoid contact with eyes. If contact occurs, rinse well with water.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: OMG I LOVE this shampoo. I used to be so scared of clarifying shampoos as a curly girl and now I can't go without it. I use a lot of product to make my 4a / 4b hair curl  and stay like i want it to. So this helps get all the gels and gunk off. Furthermore, it makes it so that my CONDITIONER WORKS LIKE CRAZY. WHOA. I didn't even know shampoos did that! But like... my hair comes out sooooo moisturized and hydrated. My curls start clumping the minute I put this shampoo on. Like, now I detangle before I shampoo because as soon as I put this shampoo on my curls start clumping and defining and getting so pretty.... i barely want to touch them! lol. Highly recommend. Total sleeper. My hair never feels stripped or dry. Just naked. But definitely follow up with conditioner, moisturizers and creams, ya know. It preps your hair to absorb all that. reeeeaallly, really good. I have to stop myself from using it every time I wash. Because I love it that much. Curly girls really only need to clarify like... once a month? Every 2 weeks? LOVE.
